When DIC Is Not Payable Under 38 U.S.C. 1318
Benefits under
38 U.S.C. 1318
are not payable if
the cause of death is found to have been the result of a Veteran’s own willful misconduct, or
the Veteran’s death was wrongfully and intentionally caused by the claimant.
Note
:  Absent evidence to the contrary in Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) records or on the death certificate, presume that the cause of death was not due to the Veteran's willful misconduct.
References
:  For more information on
willful misconduct, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, 1.C
, and
development action when the Veteran’s death is a homicide, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, 2.B.2
.
